Explanation.name: anchors
Explanation.description: where you want the origin of the texture. *"texture" uses the texture coordinates supplied *"screen" uses the origin of the screen as the origin of the texture

Explanation.name: blending function
Explanation.description: how to blend the textures together

Explanation.name: map scales
Explanation.description: how much to scale the textures

Explanation.name: map offsets
Explanation.description: how much to offset the origin of the texture

Explanation.name: map
Explanation.description: which maps to use

Explanation.name: source/destination
Explanation.description: These describe the relationship that causes the effect. * destination type is the type of variable you want to be effected * destination tells which texture map (or geometry offset) to apply it to * source says which value to look at when computing the effect

Explanation.name: in/out bounds
Explanation.description: When the source is at the lower inbound, the destination ends up the lower outbound and vice-versa applies for the upper values.

Explanation.name: tint color bounds
Explanation.description: If destination is tint, these values are used instead of the out bounds.

Explanation.name: periodic functions
Explanation.description: If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

Explanation.name: periodic functions
Explanation.description: If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

Bit.name: interpolate between min/max flash colors as state changes

ShortInteger.name: value scale
ShortInteger.description: used for non-integral values, i.e. health and shields

Explanation.description: The blips use this as a reference point
